title: Merrimack women's hockey falls to Robert Morris
text:
Merrimack women's hockey falls to Robert Morris 
The Merrimack women’s hockey team fell behind early and couldn’t recover, losing to Robert Morris 6-1 in the program’s first ever road game. 
Robert Morris got started with a goal 1:57 into the game, and things continued to spiral from there. The Colonials would add two power play goals midway through the period, and then a fourth right before the break to make it 4-0. 
The Colonials scored twice more in the second, with the first coming off another power play and the second moments after a penalty had expired. Merrimack finally got on the board early in the third on a top-corner slapshot from freshman Beatrice Dufour, but that’s all the offense the Warriors were able to muster. 
Merrimack (0-3) will face Robert Morris again today at 3:05 p.m., and will then return home next Saturday to face UNH. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
